privates.name: P2: Cotton Warehouse
privates.description: This company has a $10 token which may be placed in any non-coastal city (Atlantic or Gulf Coast) as an extra token lay during the token placement step of an owning public company's operating round.

privates.name: P3: Atlantic Shipping
privates.description: This company has a Port token which may be placed on any city on the coasts an extra token lay during the token placement step of an owning public company's operating round. All eligible cities are marked with an anchor symbol. This token increases the value of the selected city by $20 for the owning company and by $10 for all other companies.

privates.name: P4: London Investment
privates.description: This company represents those shrewd investors in London. They have hired you to invest their money in the new Southern railways. They will purchase a share in your choice of any newly started company. You get the share. After the company pays its first dividend, the London Investment Company is closed, as they realize they have paid you for nothing and you spent the money for yourself.

privates.name: P5: West Virginia Coalfields
privates.description: This private company gives the owning company a WVCF token for free. When other companies connect to the coal fields, they may buy a WVCF token (if available) during their operating round for $80 ($40 goes to the company owning the WVCF private company).

privates.name: P6: Southern Bank (var)
privates.description: You may loan money to your company by taking out a mortgage on a company asset. The mortgage value is from half to double the value of the asset. At the start of each operating round, the company will pay you 10% interest (10% of the value of the mortgaged asset). If the company does not have enough money to pay the interest, it pays nothing. The company will repay the mortgage for half to full value of the asset.

privates.name: P7: Central Railroad & Canal
privates.description: Comes with the president's share of the Central of Georgia Railway. The player buying this private company must immediately set the par value of the CoG.

notes.note: Dividends for shares in the open market are paid to the bank.
No more than 50% of a corporation's shares may be in the market at any time
Shares cannot be sold during the first stock round

turns.name: Stock Round
steps: Sell any number of shares then buy one share
Buy one share then sell any number of shares

turns.name: Merger Phase
steps: Conducted after each SR during Phases 4 and 5

legend.description: Shares of this corporation do not count toward the certificate limit
Players may own more than 60% of this corporation
Players may purchase any number of shares of this corporation in one stock action
Companies entering this area are immediately closed.
